# Mitch LaKind

 

[Town Council](https://www.townofmonument.org/Directory.aspx?DID=14)  
Title: Mayor  
[mlakind@tomgov.org](mailto:mlakind@tomgov.org)

Mayor Mitch LaKind brings over 30 years of experience in the Information Technology industry, specializing in messaging and collaboration platforms, mobile device management, and information security. Throughout his career, he has led IT initiatives for major organizations, ensuring secure and efficient technology solutions.

Originally from Scottsdale, Arizona, Mayor LaKind relocated to Monument in January 2018 with his partner, Carol. Drawn to the town’s small-town charm, four-season climate, stunning mountain views, and dynamic weather, they quickly embraced the community. Both have daughters who continue to reside in Arizona.

A lifelong learner, Mayor LaKind has cultivated his IT expertise through self-directed education, complemented by ongoing training from Microsoft and other industry leaders. He holds multiple industry-recognized certifications in IT infrastructure and enterprise collaboration solutions, reflecting his commitment to staying at the forefront of technology advancements.

Mayor LaKind was elected to the Board of Trustees in April 2020 and subsequently elected as Mayor of the Town Council in November 2022. Since joining the Town Council, he has been instrumental in driving key initiatives focused on responsible growth, infrastructure improvements, and fiscal responsibility.

In addition to his role as Mayor, he represents the Town of Monument on state legislative matters and serves as a board member of the Pikes Peak Area Council of Governments (PPACG), advocating for regional collaboration on transportation, economic development, and other critical issues.

A U.S. Navy veteran, Mayor LaKind brings leadership experience from his military service to his role in public office. He is also a lifelong member of the Veterans of Foreign Wars (VFW), continuing his commitment to supporting fellow veterans and their families.
